snippet: A congressional proposal that just might work in a post-Citizens United world.
abstract: Joe Nocera Op-Ed column submits that bill sponsored by Rep John Sarbanes, Democrat from Maryland, that is aimed at boosting role of small donors in campaign finance may provide hope to electorate increasingly frustrated by influence of big money in politics; holds that bill, which combines tax credit with matching fund system, may have added benefit of forcing politicians to solicit views of their constituents, and not just rich donors.
lead_paragraph: A congressional proposal that just might work in a post-Citizens United world.
